trans-unit.source: Get started with push (Android) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with push (Android) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android .Net app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android .Net app.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you add push notifications using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) to the quickstart project.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you add push notifications using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) to the quickstart project.

trans-unit.source: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification each time a record is inserted.
trans-unit.target: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification each time a record is inserted.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Get started with data] to connect your project to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Get started with data] to connect your project to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: As such, this tutorial also requires Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: As such, this tutorial also requires Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For the Eclipse version of this tutorial, see [Get started with push notifications (Eclipse)].
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For the Eclipse version of this tutorial, see [Get started with push notifications (Eclipse)].

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: Configure your mobile service to send push requests
trans-unit.target: Configure your mobile service to send push requests

trans-unit.source: Update the mobile service to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the mobile service to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your app

trans-unit.source: Verify Android SDK Version
trans-unit.target: Verify Android SDK Version

trans-unit.source: Your next step is to install Google Play services.
trans-unit.target: Your next step is to install Google Play services.

trans-unit.source: Google Cloud Messaging has some minimum API level requirements for development and testing, which the **minSdkVersion** property in the Manifest must conform to.
trans-unit.target: Google Cloud Messaging has some minimum API level requirements for development and testing, which the **minSdkVersion** property in the Manifest must conform to.

trans-unit.source: If you will be testing with an older device, then consult [Set Up Google Play Services SDK] to determine how low you can set this value, and set it appropriately.
trans-unit.target: If you will be testing with an older device, then consult [Set Up Google Play Services SDK] to determine how low you can set this value, and set it appropriately.

trans-unit.source: Add Google Play Services to the project
trans-unit.target: Add Google Play Services to the project

trans-unit.source: Add code
trans-unit.target: Add code

trans-unit.source: Test the app against the published mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the app against the published mobile service

trans-unit.source: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.

trans-unit.source: Enable push notifications for local testing
trans-unit.target: Enable push notifications for local testing

trans-unit.source: You have successfully completed this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You have successfully completed this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an Android app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an Android app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing the next tutorial, [Send push notifications to authenticated users], which shows how to use tags to send push notifications from your mobile service to only an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing the next tutorial, [Send push notifications to authenticated users], which shows how to use tags to send push notifications from your mobile service to only an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: [Send push notifications to authenticated users]
trans-unit.target: [Send push notifications to authenticated users]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use tags to send push notifications from a Mobile Service to only an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use tags to send push notifications from a Mobile Service to only an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: [Send broadcast notifications to subscribers]
trans-unit.target: [Send broadcast notifications to subscribers]

trans-unit.source: Learn how users can register and receive push notifications for categories they're interested in.
trans-unit.target: Learn how users can register and receive push notifications for categories they're interested in.

trans-unit.source: [Send template-based notifications to subscribers]
trans-unit.target: [Send template-based notifications to subscribers]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use templates to send push notifications from a Mobile Service, without having to craft platform-specific payloads in your back-end.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use templates to send push notifications from a Mobile Service, without having to craft platform-specific payloads in your back-end.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about Mobile Services and Notification Hubs in the following topics:
trans-unit.target: Learn more about Mobile Services and Notification Hubs in the following topics:

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to your app][Get started with authentication]
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to your app][Get started with authentication]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with different account types using mobile services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with different account types using mobile services.

trans-unit.source: [What are Notification Hubs?]
trans-unit.target: [What are Notification Hubs?]

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how Notification Hubs works to deliver notifications to your apps across all major client platforms.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how Notification Hubs works to deliver notifications to your apps across all major client platforms.

trans-unit.source: [Debug Notification Hubs applications](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=386630)
trans-unit.target: [Debug Notification Hubs applications](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=386630)

trans-unit.source: Get guidance troubleshooting and debugging Notification Hubs solutions.
trans-unit.target: Get guidance troubleshooting and debugging Notification Hubs solutions.

trans-unit.source: [How to use the Android client library for Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [How to use the Android client library for Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with Android.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with Android.
